text:
Miscellaneous.-Dr. G. Lincecum presented 36 jars of zoological specimens from Texas ; Mr. Cope presented a collection of Indian relics; and an antique copper hammer from Lake Superior was presented by S. F. Peck. Miscellaneous specimens were presented by Jos. M. Valdespino, Dr. Shippen, J. K. Thompson, F. Dick, Dr. John C. Spear, U. S. A., F. Coxe, J. G. McClenahan, J. Cassin, H. Allen and S. B. Howell.

Respectfully submitted by
JOSEPH LEIDY,
Chairman of the Curators.

REPORT OF THE LIBRARIAN.

The Librarian ian most respectfully reports that the number of donations to the Library from January to December, 1867, inclusive, is 1681.

\begin{tabular}{l r}
Of these there were volumes & 380 \\
pamphlets & 1295 \\
maps & 6 \\
 
Total & 1681 \\
\end{tabular}

As follows:

\begin{tabular}{l r}
Folios & 28 \\
Quartos & 418 \\
Octavos & 1207 \\
Duodecimos & 22 \\
Maps & 6 \\
 
Total & 1681 \\
\end{tabular}

These were derived from the following sources:

\begin{tabular}{l r}
Editors & 157 \\
Authors & 209 \\
Societies & 629 \\
Library Fund & 201 \\
Wilson Fund & 160 \\
Geo. W. Tryon, Jr. \\
Publishers & 8 \\
Minister of Public Works, France & 7 \\
Dr. Jos. Leidy & 4 \\
S. S. Haldeman & 17 \\
J. Gwyn Jeffreys & 14 \\
A. \& H. Adams & 38 \\
Hon. Secretary of the Navy & 1 \\
Wm. S. Vaux & 1 \\
Treasury Department & 7 \\
U. S. Coast Survey & 1 \\
Smithsonian Institution & 6 \\
Geological Survey of India & 7 \\
Hon. Leonard Myers & 1 \\
Hon. Chas. Sumner & 1 \\
Mrs. Lucy W. Say & 1 \\
Chas. E. Smith & 1 \\
Surgeon General U. S. A & 2 \\
 
Total & 1681 & & \\
\end{tabular}

And were divided as follows:

\begin{tabular}{l r}
Anatomy and Physiology & 13 \\
Bibliography & 14 \\
Botany & 39 \\
Chemistry & 1 \\
208 & Conchology & 328 \\
Entomology & 45 \\
General Natural History & 53 \\
Geology & 103 \\
Helminthology & 6 \\
Herpetology & 4 \\
Ichthyology & 8 \\
Journals & 959 \\
Languages & 3 \\
Mammalogy & 5 \\
Medicine & 19 \\
Mineralogy & 14 \\
Ornithology & 33 \\
Physical Science & 21 \\
Useful Arts & 1 \\
Voyages and Travels & 12 \\
Total & 1681 \\
\end{tabular}

One hundred and sixty volumes and two hundred and thirty three pamphlets were presented through the Conchological Section of the Academy.

All of which is respectfully submitted. J. D. SERGEAN'T.
1867.]
